title.narrative: Legal Aid for Women and Girls against SGBV

description.narrative:
The Legal Aid for Women and Girls against SGBV project is in line with NAWL’s endeavor to create a nationwide human rights and constitutional rights awareness against SGBV and capacity building to community leaders, women leaders, girls, boys and youth groups to understand their rights and advocate for the protection of women and girls’ rights. This advocacy aims at eliminating elements of SGBV and ensure respect for women rights necessary for peaceful coexistence and confidence in institutions dealing with (custodians of) the rule of law..
The project will be implemented in Juba and will involve a cross section of partners or duty bearers including; the police, prisons and judicial officials, women groups and Community leaders as well religious and youth leaders. The project will focus on awareness raising for girls and women with the view of enhancing their understanding of their rights and the available legal protection platforms, where they can find a space for the restoration of their confidence in the legal system. Formation of a network of women and girls’ leaders, where they will hold forums with girls and women groups to unlock their minds to be able to deal head-on with barriers of access to justice. During the project cycle, a total of 200 women and young girls in this network shall receive training on legal awareness. A team of women lawyers, volunteers and women representatives shall hold Six (6) radio talk shows on legal rights issues in Juba, with call-in lines for public participation. It shall also document successes and challenges of access to justice. Through Legal Aid, legal protection shall be enhanced through assessment and analysis of the capacity gaps in the duty bearers (the police, prisons and judicial officials and traditional authorities). Lastly a review of national legislations against international and customary laws shall be undertaken to resolve any outstanding conflict of laws this will be mainstream into the entire work of the protection.
